info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 4 at 8:42AM MDT until August 4 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible especially in burn scars and flood-prone areas.
* WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following county, Idaho.
This includes the following Specific Areas... Highway 95 from Riggins to Whitebird, Shepp Ranch near the Salmon River, Indian Creek near the Salmon River, Mackay Bar near the Salmon River, China Bar, Hig03hway 95 north of Riggins, Williams Creek Fire Burn Area, Magruder Fire Burn Area, and Grangeville.
* WHEN...From 1 PM MDT /noon PDT/ this afternoon to 6 PM MDT /5 PM PDT/ this evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in rock and mudslides, flooding of small creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - https://www.weather.gov/mso/hydrology
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MDT /NOON PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM MDT /5 PM PDT/ THIS EVENING
